c74object.name: ta.clipnotes
c74object.description: Clip MIDI notes properly by changing octave while maintaining the virtual pitch. Also works with lists of pitches or lists of notes (pitch velocity pairs).

inlet.description: Input notes are clipped by a given minimum and maximum limit, while maintaining the virtual pitch of input notes.

outlet.description: Output notes maintain the same "virtual" pitch as the input notes, clippping notes by register.

objarg.name: minimum
objarg.description: The minimum value is the lower note to the range of output values allowed. If only one argument is present, it is used as both the minimum and maximum limit. If no argument is present, the minimum is 0 and the aximum limit is 127.

objarg.name: maximum
objarg.description: The maximum value is the higher note to the range of output values allowed. If only one argument is present, it is used as both the minimum and maximum limit. If no argument is present, the minimum is 0 and the aximum limit is 127.

method.name: int
method.description: The number is sent out the outlet, constrained within the minimum and maximum notes specified by the minimum and maximum limits. The ta.clipnotes object adapts the clipped output values to its input, so an integer input value will output an integer value regardless of the numeric type specified as an argument. And it also maintains the virtual pitch, meaning the clipped notes will always have the same virtual pitch as the input. When ta.clipnotes can not maintain the virtual pitch it will drop the input through the right outlet.

method.name: float
method.description: The number is sent out the outlet, constrained within the minimum and maximum limits. The clip object adapts the clipped output values to its input, so a floating point input value will output a floating point value regardless of the numeric type specified as an argument. And it also maintains the virtual pitch, meaning the clipped notes will always have the same virtual pitch as the input. When ta.clipnotes can not maintain the virtual pitch it will drop the input through the right outlet.

method.name: list
method.description: ta.clipnotes behaviour regarding lists depends on the mode attribute. If this attribute is set to "pitchlist", ta.clipnotes will treat input lists as a series of pitch numbers. And if the mode attribute is set to "notelist", ta.clipnotes will treat input lists as a series of pitch-velocity pairs.

method.name: set
method.description: The word set, followed by two numbers, resets the minimum and maximum limits. If only one number is provided it will set both the minimum and maximum limits.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: If mode is set to "pitchlist", ta.clipnotes will treat input lists as a series of pitch numbers. And if the mode attribute is set to "notelist", ta.clipnotes will treat input lists as a series of pitch-velocity pairs, passing velocity values along with the respective notes. (default = "notelist")

attribute.name: maxsize
attribute.description: Maximum output list size. ta.clipnotes will break the input list into groups with the same size as the maxsize and will truncate the remaining list if it has a smaller size than the maxsize. Example: if the input list is "1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8", and the maxsize is 3, ta.clipnotes will output two lists ("1 2 3" and "1 2 3") and will discard the remaing items ("6 8"). (default = 128)

example.caption: Constrain played notes to a given octave

entry.name: int/float/list
entry.description: Out left outlet: Clipped notes. If the clipping process is able to maintain the input notes' virtual pitch. Otherwise input notes are sent to the rightmost outlet.

entry.name: int/float
entry.description: Out right outlet: Dropped notes. If the clipping process is not able to maintain the input notes' virtual pitch it will drop the input numbers through this outlet. Note that dropped notes can won't carry the input velocity value, if the input is a pitch-velocity pair.
